DataElement.preferredName: Edmonton Frail Scale 11 Timed Get Up and Go Test Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result of a physical test that measures how long a person takes to stand from sitting position in a chair and walk to a mark on the floor, return to the chair and sit down, using a 3 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edmonton Frail Scale Timed Get Up and Go Test Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility._A test that measures the amount of time it takes a person to rise from a chair, walk to a designated point, and return to sitting._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility.

Concepts.definition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility.

Property.preferredName: Timed Get Up and Go Test Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A test that measures the amount of time it takes a person to rise from a chair, walk to a designated point, and return to sitting.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Timed Get Up and Go Test
Concepts.definition: A test that measures the amount of time it takes a person to rise from a chair, walk to a designated point, and return to sitting.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual can perform a walking exercise in 0-10 seconds.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual can perform a walking exercise in 0-10 seconds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual can perform a walking exercise in 11-20 seconds.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual can perform a walking exercise in 11-20 seconds.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: One of >20 s, or patient unwilling, or require assistance

ValueMeaning.preferredName: One of >20 s, or patient unwilling, or require assistance
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual can perform a walking exercise in greater than 20 seconds, or patient was unwilling, or required assistance to perform a walking exercise.

Concepts.longName: Greater Than Twenty Seconds Walking, or Patient Unwilling, or Requires Assistance Walking
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual can perform a walking exercise in greater than 20 seconds, or patient was unwilling, or required assistance to perform a walking exercise.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: I would like you to sit in this chair with your back and arms resting. Then, when I say 'GO', please stand up and walk at a safe and comfortable pace to the mark on the floor (approximately 3 m away), return to the chair and sit down

DataElement.origin: EFS:Edmonton Frail Scale; Rolfson et al., Validity and Reliability of the Edmonton Frail Scale, Age Ageing 2006; Sep Epub 2006
